tit.e: Town's name of the Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City
Name of Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City
Town names of the Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City

sen.j: 本項京都市西京区の町名（きょうとし にしきょうくのちょうめい）では、同区内に存在する公称町名を一覧化するとともに、その成立時期・成立過程等について概説する。
sen.e: This section, the Town's name of the Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City, shows the list of the official town's names in the Ukyo Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.
This section, shows the list of official town names in the Ukyo Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.
This section shows the list of official town names in the Nishikyo Ward and summarizes the period and process of their establishment.

tit.e: The summary of the Nishikyo Ward

sen.j: 京都市街地の西南方、桂川の右岸に位置する。
sen.e: It is located in the right bank of the Katsura-gawa River, which is south-west of the urban area of Kyoto City.
It is located on the right bank of the Katsura-gawa River, which is south-west of the urban area of Kyoto City.
The ward is located on the right bank of the Katsura-gawa River, which is south-west of the urban area of Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 周囲を右京区、南区 (京都市)、京都府向日市、京都府長岡京市、大阪府島本町、大阪府高槻市、京都府亀岡市に接する。
sen.e: It has a border with the Ukyo Ward, Minami Ward (Kyoto City), the Muko City and the Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture, the Shimamoto Town and the Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture, and the Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.
It is bordered by Ukyo Ward, Minami Ward (Kyoto City), Muko City and Nagaokakyo City, Kyoto Prefecture, Shimamoto Town Takatsuki City, Osaka Prefecture, as well as Kameoka City, Kyoto Prefecture.

It shares a border with Ukyo Ward, Minami Ward (Kyoto City), Muko City and Nagaokakyo City in Kyoto Prefecture, Shimamoto Town and Takatsuki City in Osaka Prefecture, as well as Kameoka City in Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 面積59.20平方キロメートル。
sen.e: It is 59.20 square km in area.
It is 59.20 square km in area.
It is 59.20 square km in area.

sen.j: 2009年3月現在の推計人口は約153,000人。
sen.e: Its population is estimated about 153,000 as of March 2009.
Its population is estimated to be about 153,000 as of March 2009.
Its population is estimated to be about 153,000 as of March 2009.

sen.j: 観光地として名高い嵐山、松尾大社のある松尾地区、桂離宮のある桂地区、勝持寺（花の寺）や大原野神社がある大原野地区は当区に属する。
sen.e: It includes Arashiyama, a famous sightseeing spot, the Matsuo district where the Matsuo-taisha Shrine is located, the Katsura district where the Katsura Imperial Villa is located, and the Ohara district where the Shoji-ji Temple (the Temple of Flowers) and the Oharano-jinja Shrine are located.

It includes Arashiyama, a famous sightseeing spot, the Matsuo district where the Matsuo-taisha Shrine is located, the Katsura district where the Katsura Imperial Villa is located, and the Ohara district where the Shoji-ji Temple (the Temple of Flowers) and the Oharano-jinja Shrine are located.

It includes Arashiyama, a famous sightseeing spot, the Matsuo district where the Matsuo-taisha Shrine is located, the Katsura district where the Katsura Imperial Villa is located, and the Ohara district where the Shoji-ji Temple (the Temple of Flowers) and the Oharano-jinja Shrine are located.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。ji, jinjaの前に-を入れました。

sen.j: 他にも苔寺として知られる西芳寺、西国札所の善峯寺などの著名社寺が多い。
sen.e: In addition to these, there are many famous temples and shrines such as the Saiho-ji Temple (known as Koke-dera Temple) and the Yoshimine-dera Temple which is one of the temples of Saigoku fudasho (temples for pilgrimage in western Japan).

In addition to these, there are many famous temples and shrines such as the Saiho-ji Temple (known as Koke-dera Temple) and the Yoshimine-dera Temple which is one of the temples of Saigoku fudasho (temples for pilgrimage in western Japan).

In addition to these, there are many famous temples and shrines such as the Saiho-ji Temple (known as Koke-dera Temple) and the Yoshimine-dera Temple which is one of the temples of Saigoku Fudasho (temples for pilgrimage in western Japan).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。jiの前に-を入れました。

sen.j: 洛西ニュータウンも当区に位置する。
sen.e: It also includes Rakusai New Town.
It also includes Rakusai New Town.
It also covers Rakusai New Town.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 西端の外畑（とのはた）、出灰（いずりは）地区は大阪府と接している。
sen.e: The Tonohata and Izuriha districts in the western edge have a border with the Osaka Prefecture.
The Tonohata and Izuriha districts on the western edge are bordered by Osaka Prefecture.
The Tonohata and Izuriha districts on the western edge are bordered by Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 当区はもと右京区の一部であり、昭和51年（1976年）に桂川右岸の地域が分区して成立したものである。
sen.e: This ward was originally a part of the Ukyo Ward, and it was established by the separation of the area of the right bank of the Katsura-gawa River in 1976.
This ward was originally a part of Ukyo Ward, and it was established when the area of the right bank of the Katsura-gawa River was separated in 1976.
This ward, originally a part of Ukyo Ward, was established when the area of the right bank of the Katsura-gawa River was separated in 1976.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 区の北部から東部は昭和6年（1931年）、当時の右京区に編入された、旧葛野郡（かどのぐん）の松尾村、桂村、川岡村の区域である。
sen.e: The area from the northern part to the eastern part consists of the former Matsuo, Katsura and Kawaoka villages, Kadono County, which were integrated into the Ukyo Ward in 1931.
The area from the northern part to the eastern part consists of the former Matsuo, Katsura and Kawaoka villages, Kadono County, which were integrated into Ukyo Ward in 1931.
The area from the northern to the eastern part consists of the former Matsuo, Katsura and Kawaoka villages, Kadono County, which were integrated into Ukyo Ward in 1931.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 区の南部から西部はもとの乙訓郡大枝村と同郡大原野村で、前者は昭和25年（1950年）、後者は昭和34年（1959年）、当時の右京区に編入されている。
sen.e: The area from the southern part to the western part consists of the former Oeda and Ohara villages, Otokuni County, which were integrated into the Ukyo Ward in 1950 and in 1959, respectively.
The area from the southern part to the western part consists of the former Oeda and Ohara villages, Otokuni County, which were integrated into Ukyo Ward in 1950 and in 1959, respectively.
The area from the southern part to the western part consists of the former Oeda and Oharano villages, Otokuni County, which were integrated into Ukyo Ward in 1950 and in 1959, respectively.

sen.j: 京都市内の町名には「大原来迎院町」のように旧村名、旧大字名に由来する地名（上記例の場合は「大原」）を冠称するものと、「亀屋町」「菊屋町」のような単独町名とがある。
sen.e: The town's names in the Kyoto City are categorized into the one which uses the former village name or former Oaza (larger section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara') and the one which uses an independent name of town such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-chi.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The town names in Kyoto City are categorized into ones which use the former village name or former Oaza (larger section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara') and ones which uses an independent name such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-chi.'

The town names in Kyoto City are categorized into ones which use the former village name or former Oaza (larger section of village) such as 'Ohara Raikoin-cho' (in this case, 'Ohara') and ones which uses an independent name such as 'Kameya-cho' and 'Kikuya-cho.'

sen.j: 西京区内の町名はごく一部の例外を除いて、旧大字名などの地区名を冠した複合町名である。
sen.e: The town's names in the Nishikyo Ward all includes district's names such as former Oaza on the head with no exceptions.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The town's names in the Nishikyo Ward all includes district's names such as former Oaza on the head with no exceptions.
The town names in Nishikyo Ward all include district names such as former Oaza as a prefix.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 区内の公称町名の数は、『角川日本地名大辞典 26 京都府』下巻によれば1980年現在276町であった。
sen.e: According to the second volume of "the Kadokawa dictionary of the place-name of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture," there were officially two-hundred and seventy-six towns in 1980.
According to the second volume of "the Kadokawa dictionary of the place-name of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture," there were officially two-hundred and seventy-six towns in 1980.

sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: その後、一部地区で土地区画整理事業実施等に伴う町名町界の変更があり、16町が新たに起立、6町が廃止された。
sen.e: After that, the names and borders of some towns were changed in accordance with the implementation of land readjustment projects, and the sixteen towns were newly created and the six towns were abolished.

sen.e: After that, the names and borders of some towns were changed in accordance with the implementation of land readjustment projects, and sixteen towns were newly created and six towns were abolished.

sen.j: 2009年現在は286町となっている（大枝北沓掛町一丁目〜七丁目のように「丁目」を有するものは全体を1町と数える）。
sen.e: As of 2009, there are two-hundred and eighty-six towns (the towns which have the name 'chome' such as Oeda Kitakutsukake-cho from icchome (No.1) to nanachome (No.7), are counted as one town).

sen.j: 区内には「嵐山南松尾山」「御陵南谷」のように、末尾に「町」字を付さない町名が一部に存在する。
sen.e: There are some towns which have no letters of 'cho' (which means 'town') as a suffix, such as 'Arashiyama Minami Matsuoyama' and 'Goryo Minamitani.'

sen.j: これらは、山間部などで、昭和6年の町名成立時において当該区域内に人家が存在しなかったものである。

tit.e: The list of the official town's names

sen.j: 旧葛野郡松尾村は、昭和6年（1931年）京都市に編入され、当時の右京区の一部となった。
sen.e: The former Matsuo village, Kadono County, was integrated into the Kyoto City in 1931, and became a part of the Ukyo Ward in those days.
The former Matsuo village, Kadono County, was integrated into Kyoto City in 1931, and became a part of Ukyo Ward in those days.
The former Matsuo village, Kadono County, was integrated into Kyoto City in 1931, and became a part of the then Ukyo Ward.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 松尾村には嵐山、松室、松尾谷、下山田、御陵の5つの大字があった。
sen.e: There were the five Oaza of Arashiyama, Matsumuro, Matsuodani, Shimoyamada and Goryo in the Matsuo village.
There were the five Oaza of Arashiyama, Matsumuro, Matsuodani, Shimoyamada and Goryo in the Matsuo village.

sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: このうち、大字嵐山（旧・上山田村）は昭和6年、「嵐山」を冠称する20町に編成された。
sen.e: Among them, the Oaza Arashiyama (the former Kamiyamada village) was reorganized into twenty towns which had the name of 'Arashiyama' on the head in 1931.
Among them, the Oaza Arashiyama (the former Kamiyamada village) was reorganized into twenty towns which were headed by the name 'Arashiyama' in 1931.
Among them, the Oaza Arashiyama (the former Kamiyamada village) was reorganized into twenty towns which were prefixed by the name 'Arashiyama' in 1931.

sen.j: その後、昭和20年（1945年）頃に宮町、昭和26年（1951年）に虚空蔵山町が成立し、現在は22町となっている。
sen.e: After that, the Miyamachi town was established in 1945 and the Kokuzoyama-cho town was established in 1951, so that there are twenty-two towns at present.
After that, the Miyamachi town was established in 1945 and Kokuzoyama-cho town was established in 1951, leading to the current twenty-two towns.

sen.j: 大字松室は昭和6年、「松室」を冠称する13町に編成された。
sen.e: The Oaza Matsumuro was reorganized into the thirteen towns which had the name of 'Matsumoru' on the head in 1931.

sen.j: 大字松尾谷は昭和6年大部分が「松尾」を冠称する9町に編成され、残余は右京区大字松尾谷となった。
sen.e: The Oaza Matsuodani was mostly reorganized into the nine towns which had the name of 'Matsuo' on the head in 1931, and the rest became Oaza Matsuodani, Ukyo Ward.

sen.j: 昭和17年、松尾大利町が成立。
sen.e: In 1942, the Matsuodairi-cho town was established.

sen.j: 昭和40年（1965年）、当時の京都市内各所に残存していた「大字○○字XX」の区域はすべて「町」となり、「○○XX町」と改称された。
sen.e: In 1965 the all districts which included the place-name, 'Oaza OOand Aza (section of village) XX,' in those days were changed into 'town' and their names were also changed into 'OOXX town.'
In 1965 all districts which included the place-name, 'Oaza OOand Aza (section of village) XX,' were changed into 'town' and their names also changed into 'OOXX town.'

In 1965, all places in Kyoto City whose names included the terms 'Oaza' and 'Aza' (the latter meaning a small section of a village) were renamed with the suffix 'cho', therefore, a place called 'Oaza XX Aza YY' would have been renamed 'XXYY-cho'.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。"を ' に変更しました。

sen.j: この際、「大字松尾谷」として存続していた区域は松尾谷松尾山町となった。

At this time, the area of 'Oaza Matsuodani' became the Matsuodani Matsuoyamacho Town.

sen.j: 以上により、現在は「松尾」を冠称する町名が10、「松尾谷」を冠称する町名が1となっている。

sen.j: 大字御陵は昭和6年、「御陵」を冠称する16町に編成された。
sen.e: The Oaza Goryo was reorganized into the sixteen towns which had the name of 'Goryo' on the head in 1931.
The Oaza Goryo was reorganized into sixteen towns which were headed by the name 'Goryo' in 1931.

sen.j: 桂坂ニュータウン開発に伴い、昭和61年、御陵北大枝山町、御陵大枝山町一丁目〜六丁目、御陵峰ケ堂町一丁目〜三丁目が成立し、19町となっている（「丁目」を有するものは全体を1町と数える）。
sen.e: In accordance with the development of Katsurazaka New Town, Goryo Kitaoedayama-cho, Goryo Oedayama-cho from icchome to rokuchome (No.1-6 chome), and Goryo Minegado-cho from icchome to sanchome (No.1-3 chome) were established in 1986, so that there are nineteen towns at present (the towns which have the name 'chome' are counted as one town).

In accordance with the development of Katsurazaka New Town, Goryo Kitaoedayama-cho, Goryo Oedayama-cho from icchome to rokuchome (No.1-6 chome), and Goryo Minegado-cho from icchome to sanchome (No.1-3 chome) were established in 1986, so that there are nineteen towns at present (the towns which have the name 'chome' are counted as one town).

In accordance with the development of Katsurazaka New Town, Goryo Kitaoedayamacho, Goryo Oedayamacho from 1-chome to 6-chome, and Goryo Minegadocho from 1-chome to 3-chome were established in 1986, therefore, that there are now nineteen towns at present (the towns which have the name 'chome' are counted as one town).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: なお、西京区の「御陵」は「ごりょう」と読むが、山科区の「御陵」は「みささぎ」と読む。
sen.e: The Chinese character '御陵' in the Nishikyo Ward is pronounced as 'Goryo,' but the one in the Yamashina Ward is pronounced as 'Misasagi.'

sen.j: 上記のほか、平成15年（2003年）には御陵地区と山田地区にまたがって新町名「京都大学桂」が起立されている。

sen.j: 旧葛野郡桂村は、昭和6年京都市に編入され、当時の右京区の一部となった。

sen.j: 『角川日本地名大辞典 26 京都府』では山間部に位置する無人町とする。
sen.e: According to the second volume of "the Kadokawa dictionary of the place-name of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture" ('Kadokawa' in bellow), they are the mountain area where no one lives.
According to the second volume of "the Kadokawa dictionary of the place-name of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture" ('Kadokawa' in bellow), they are mountainous areas where no one lives.
According to the second volume of "Kadokawa Nihon Chimei Daijiten No. 26 Kyoto-Fu" (Kadokawa dictionary of place-names of Japan, No.26 Kyoto Prefecture), they are mountainous areas uninhabited.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。
